item.title: New Video: How to Build a Rocket Body from Household Items
item.dc:creator: Josh Moody
item.description:
In this video, we explain the basic principles of rocket body design and demonstrate how to make a simple one out of cardboard.

The post New Video: How to Build a Rocket Body from Household Items appeared first on Blasted Science.
item.content:encoded:
Okay, maybe it isn’t that new of a video, but at least we’re finally getting around to posting it on this site.

As we mentioned in our last video, our rocket engines don’t work very well on their own. They have zero aerodynamics and mostly just spin around randomly in the air like an untied balloon. In this video, we explain the basic principles of rocket body design and demonstrate how to make one out of cardboard. It’s ridiculously easy.

When making these rockets, keep in mind that they are extremely finicky and precise; many rocket will fail before you get one to work. Even at our peak, we weren’t able to get more than about 50% of our rockets to fly well. Make sure your rocket body is well-designed!

The post New Video: How to Build a Rocket Body from Household Items appeared first on Blasted Science.
item.series:name: Homemade Rocketry

item.title: New Video: How to Make Rocket Engines from Scratch
item.dc:creator: Josh Moody
item.description:
Blasted Science has been busy perfecting a cheap and simple rocket design. In this video, we explain how to make the rocket engines from scratch.

The post New Video: How to Make Rocket Engines from Scratch appeared first on Blasted Science.
item.content:encoded:
Blasted Science has been busy perfecting a cheap and simple rocket design. In this video, we explain how to make the rocket engines from scratch.

These engines work great if you build them right. However, we stress the importance of precision. In particular, make sure the end caps and nozzle are made perfectly, otherwise you’ll have a flare.

The post New Video: How to Make Rocket Engines from Scratch appeared first on Blasted Science.
item.series:name: Homemade Rocketry
